title: Two wickets in three balls as Archer removes Labuschagne and Green
summary: England's Jofra Archer gets two wickets in three balls, removing Marnus Labuschagne and Cameron Green in the first over after lunch as Australia fall to 94-4 on day one of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

title: Weatherald caught by Smith as Archer gets England breakthrough
summary: Jofra Archer removes Jake Weatherald for 18 as England make an early breakthrough against Australia, leaving the home side 33-1 on day one of the third Test in Adelaide.

title: 'Walking away a great' - Crawford retires from boxing
summary: Five-weight world champion Terence Crawford says he is "walking away as a great with nothing else left to prove" after announcing his retirement from boxing at the age of 38.

title: 'What a stunner' - Crawley takes brilliant catch to remove Head
summary: England's Zak Crawley produces a brilliant one-handed catch to remove Travis Head for 10 as Australia fall to 33-2 on day one of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

title: Australia and England pay tribute to victims of Bondi beach shooting
summary: Before the third Ashes Test in Adelaide, Australia and England players observe a moment's silence to pay respect to the victims of the Bondi Beach shooting which took place on Sunday.

title: Australia's Smith out of third Test with illness
summary: Usman Khawaja, who was left out after losing his place after experiencing back spasms in the first Test, replaces Steve Smith in the Australia XI in Adelaide.

title: 'Rediscovering joy' - Cardiff pride in Chelsea defeat
summary: Brian Barry-Murphy takes pride - and a desire to be at this level again - as his Cardiff City side lose to Chelsea in the EFL Cup quarter-finals.

title: 'Rediscovering joy' - Cardiff pride in Chelsea defeat
summary: Brian Barry-Murphy takes pride - and a desire to be at this level again - as his Cardiff City side lose to Chelsea in the EFL Cup quarter-finals.

title: Maresca 'happy' at Chelsea & 'in love' with squad
summary: Chelsea's Enzo Maresca says he is "happy" and "falling more in love with the players", days after saying he experienced "the worst 48 hours" of his tenure.

title: 'Felt like humiliation' - Egypt reacts to Salah's Liverpool row
summary: Mohamed Salah's Liverpool row felt like "humiliation" for Egyptian fans, who are rallying behind their star man before the Africa Cup of Nations begins.

title: Winning start for Price at PDC World Championship
summary: Gerwyn Price begins his bid for a second PDC world title with a convincing straight-set win against Adam Gawlas in the first round.

title: The 'eerie' parallels between Mahomes & Brady after ACL tear
summary: The Whole 10 Yards panel discusses the "eerie" similarities between the careers of Patrick Mahomes and Tom Brady, after the Chiefs quarterback tore his ACL in Sunday's defeat by the Chargers.

title: Five clubs in Semenyo chase - Wednesday's gossip
summary: Five Premier League clubs in the frame to sign Bournemouth winger Antoine Semenyo, Everton interested in Middlesbrough's Hayden Hackney, Aston Villa plan Youri Tielemans contract talks, plus more.

title: Green becomes most expensive overseas IPL player
summary: Kolkata Knight Riders sign Australia all-rounder Cameron Green for 25.2 crore (Â£2.1m) for next year's Indian Premier League.

title: Dembele wins Fifa Best men's player of the year
summary: Paris St-Germain and France forward Ousmane Dembele is named the men's player of the year at the Fifa Best awards.

title: Bonmati named Fifa Best women's player of the year
summary: Barcelona midfielder Aitana Bonmati is the women's player of the year at the Fifa Best Awards for the third year in a row, with England's Sarina Wiegman named coach of the year.

title: 'Car crash' - boxing reacts to Paul v Joshua announcement
summary: Eddie Hearn, Tony Bellew, Moses Itauma and more react to the news that Jake Paul will fight former heavyweight world champion Anthony Joshua in Miami, Florida.

title: Nancy 'grateful' for Celtic backing amid losing start
summary: Wilfried Nancy says "I don't have to prove anything to anybody" amid criticism of his losing start as Celtic manager.

title: PSG ordered to pay Mbappe 60m euros
summary: Paris St-Germain are ordered to pay former striker Kylian Mbappe 60m euros (Â£52.5m) in unpaid salary and bonuses by a French court.

title: Liverpool parade attacker jailed for 21 years and six months
summary: The married father of three is sentenced after driving at crowds "in a rage" at the victory parade.

title: Fernandes 'hurt' that Man Utd 'wanted him to go' to Saudi
summary: Manchester United captain Bruno Fernandes says it "hurt" to realise the club "wanted me to leave" when Saudi Arabia's Al-Hilal proposed a huge offer in the summer.

title: In Pictures: Sporting photos of the week
summary: A selection of some of the most striking sports photographs taken around the world over the past seven days.

title: 'Fight, determination and grit' - Stokes' team orders
summary: England Test captain Ben Stokes tells BBC Sport's Jonathan Agnew that he has "used my voice more than I have at any time in the past three and a half years" going into the must-win third Ashes Test against Australia in Adelaide.

title: Rodgers named new boss of Saudi side
summary: Brendan Rodgers is the new manager of Saudi club Al-Qadsiah after leaving Celtic in October.

title: Erratic Newcastle give Howe 'horrible feeling'

summary: Tottenham defender Micky van de Ven "never expected" the club to sack former manager Ange Postecoglou just 16 days after winning the Europa League.

summary: The ATP introduces a new extreme heat rule from 2026 which will allow players on the men's tour to take a 10-minute cooling break during best-of-three-sets singles matches.

title: Portuguese GP to return to F1 calendar in 2027
summary: Portugal will return to the F1 calendar in 2027 and 2028, with a race held at the Algarve International Circuit near Portimao.

summary: British boxer Troy Williamson - who faces Callum Simpson live on BBC on Saturday - reveals how Hurricane Melissa ruined his family home and bar in Jamaica.

summary: With an influx of new people at the head of the sport's most important bodies, the groundwork is being laid for rapid change, writes Iain Carter.

title: A 'throwback' to Man Utd's past, defensive chaos and a mesmerising classic
summary: A remarkable, chaotic, mesmerising Premier League thriller at Old Trafford between Manchester United and Bournemouth captures the imagination of all those present - even the two head coaches.

title: Rohl's Rangers roll on - should Celtic and Hearts be worried?
summary: BBC Scotland examines how Rangers have recovered domestically under Danny Rohl.

title: A lot of positives for Bournemouth in draw - Iraola
summary: Bournemouth manager Andoni Iraola says his team can take positives from their 4-4 draw at Manchester United, but that there are also "some things to correct" from the performance.

summary: Having lost the League Cup final to St Mirren, Celtic are "a diminished team with an uncertain manager, a furious support and a haunted board", writes Tom English.
